summary.overall_findings: Halliburton's public disclosures demonstrate a balance of operational and policy-level practices for responsible AI, covering 5 of 7 evaluated pillars. Operational practices include a system card for the DS365.ai Enterprise AI/ML Platform describing model capabilities and usage for transparency, and another system card for the Intelevate Digital Platform outlining the use of machine learning, human/machine collaboration, validation, and refinement for oversight. At the policy level, materials explicitly mention "bias-free" models for fairness and "explainable AI" for explainability. No qualifying public evidence was found for privacy or external accountability, based on a review of 14 publicly available sources.
